title: Civil Air Patrol Leadership Positions
text: During my time in Civil Air Patrol, I have held a variety of leadership and operational roles within the Heartland Composite Squadron. These positions have allowed me to develop critical skills in leadership, mentorship, organizational management, and technical operations while directly contributing to the success and readiness of our squadron.

title: Civil Air Patrol Leadership Positions
text: During my time in Civil Air Patrol, I have held a variety of leadership and operational roles within the Heartland Composite Squadron. These positions have allowed me to develop critical skills in leadership, mentorship, organizational management, and technical operations while directly contributing to the success and readiness of our squadron.

title: Civil Air Patrol Leadership Positions
text:
Squadron Leadership Roles

Cadet Commander
June 2024 – Present
Lead and mentor 30+ cadets in leadership development. Plan and execute weekly squadron operations for 30–50 participants. Oversee training program coordination, ensure mission readiness compliance, manage safety protocols, and coordinate squadron communications.


Flight Commander
2024–2025
Supervised a flight of 8–12 cadets during training and operations. Led drill and ceremony activities, assisted with cadet training and skill development, reported to squadron leadership on flight progress and readiness, and maintained accountability and discipline within the flight.


Public Affairs Officer (PAO)
2025
Managed photography and video documentation of squadron activities. Edited and curated media content for squadron communications, supported social media and internal communication efforts, and coordinated with squadron leadership on media coverage.


Aerospace & Communications NCO
2024–2025
Assisted with aerospace education programs and curricula. Supported communications systems and radio operations training, helped coordinate emergency services communication exercises, and maintained communications equipment and systems.


Assistant Safety NCO
2024–2025
Helped maintain safety standards during training and operations. Supported the senior safety officer in event planning and risk assessment, conducted safety briefings and orientation for cadets, monitored compliance with safety protocols, and assisted with incident reporting.


Cadet Advisory Council (CAC) Representative
2024–2025
Represented Heartland Composite Squadron at Group and Wing CAC meetings. Communicated cadet perspectives and concerns to leadership, advocated for cadet programs and activities, provided feedback on squadron readiness and cadet morale, and shared best practices across squadrons.

title: Civil Air Patrol Leadership Positions
text:
Leadership Philosophy
My approach to each position is guided by the CAP core values: Integrity, Volunteer Service, Excellence, and Respect. I believe in leading by example, mentoring over managing, communicating transparently, continuously improving, and staying mission-focused.

title: Civil Air Patrol Leadership Positions
text:
Impact
Serving in these diverse leadership positions has strengthened my ability to lead teams, mentor others, communicate effectively, manage operations, and prioritize mission success. These experiences directly support my goal to become a U.S. Air Force pilot by developing the leadership, decision-making, and professional discipline required for military service.

title: Michael Gledhill
text: Email: michael6gledhill@gmail.com | Phone: 2707741565 | LinkedIn: michael-gledhill-65a153389

title: Michael Gledhill
text:
SUMMARY
Disciplined, mission-focused leader with experience in aviation, emergency services, and structured team operations through the Civil Air Patrol. Proven ability to manage training programs, develop cadets, coordinate operations, and strengthen organizational readiness. Demonstrates high-reliability decision-making, technical problem-solving, and operational discipline.

title: Michael Gledhill
text:
EDUCATION
Brigham Young University–Idaho (Online)
Associate’s Degree, Computer Science (In Progress)
February 2024 – December 2032
Current GPA: 4.0
Homeschool Graduate (K–12)
Completed a full K–12 homeschool program, developing strong self-management, discipline, and independent learning capabilities.

title: Michael Gledhill
text:
EXPERIENCE

Cadet Commander
Civil Air Patrol – Heartland Composite Squadron | Elizabethtown, Kentucky
June 2024 - Present

Led and mentored 30+ cadets, improving leadership development, emergency services readiness, and team performance; increased cadet advancement rates by 20% over 12 months
Directed weekly operations for 30–50 participants, coordinating training, instruction, safety, logistics, and mission-focused activities
Implemented structured progression and training plans, achieving 95% mission readiness compliance across squadron programs
Earned Student Pilot Certificate and soloed in a single-engine aircraft, completing 15+ solo flight hours



3D Printer Repair Specialist
Remote Care Partners Center | Kentucky
September 2023 - June 2024

Repaired and maintained 30+ 3D printers, reducing equipment downtime by 30% and improving production reliability
Resolved 100+ technical issues across multiple printer models, ensuring consistent, high-quality medical device output
Collaborated with production and engineering teams to optimize printer workflows, accelerating device turnaround by 15% and supporting delivery of 100,000+ medical devices



Independent Seller / Electronics Resale Business (eBay)
Self-Employed | 2023 – Present

Operate a small-scale resale business focused on harvesting and selling components from older versions of medical devices, including Raspberry Pis, speakers, motors, display modules, and other electronic parts.
Evaluate, test, and prepare items for resale, maintaining consistent quality and accurate technical descriptions.
Manage listings, customer communication, inventory control, and shipping logistics with a track record of reliable fulfillment.

title: Michael Gledhill
text:
TOP SKILLS
Leadership & Development:
Leadership & Mentorship • Training & Operations Oversight • Cadet Development • Crisis Management
Operations & Management:
Program Management & Planning • Organizational Coordination • Operational Discipline • Decision-Making
Technical Skills:
Basic Python • Basic SQL • Computer Science Coursework

title: Michael Gledhill
text:
Resume
Email
LinkedIn
GitHub





Hi, I’m Michael Gledhill, Cadet Commander at Civil Air Patrol’s Heartland Composite Squadron. I lead and mentor 30+ cadets while managing training programs and emergency services operations. As a 3D printer repair specialist, I reduced equipment downtime by 30% and resolved 100+ technical issues for medical device production. I’m a certified student pilot with 15+ solo hours. I combine leadership, technical expertise, and operational discipline to drive mission-focused results.

About Me

I’m pursuing opportunities where I can contribute to mission-focused teams while continuing to develop as a professional.

title: Civil Air Patrol Encampments
text: Civil Air Patrol encampments are intensive, week-long training programs that immerse cadets in leadership development, aerospace education, emergency services, physical fitness, and professional discipline. Cadets live in a military-style environment, complete structured schedules, and participate in hands-on activities and team leadership exercises. These experiences are foundational to developing the competencies required for military service and aviation careers.

title: Civil Air Patrol Encampments
text: Civil Air Patrol encampments are intensive, week-long training programs that immerse cadets in leadership development, aerospace education, emergency services, physical fitness, and professional discipline. Cadets live in a military-style environment, complete structured schedules, and participate in hands-on activities and team leadership exercises. These experiences are foundational to developing the competencies required for military service and aviation careers.

title: Civil Air Patrol Encampments
text:
Encampment History

1. Florida Wing Winter Encampment







Field
Details




Dates
December 26, 2022 – January 4, 2023


Location
Camp Landing, Florida


Role / Activities
Attended as Basic Cadet


Description
Completed foundational cadet training, learning excellence, discipline, and leadership fundamentals. Participated in structured classes, drill and ceremony, physical fitness training, and military-style training exercises.


Key Takeaways
Established disciplinary foundation; developed understanding of CAP structure and military culture.


Rating
3–4 / 5





2. Kentucky Wing Encampment







Field
Details




Dates
2025


Location
Wendell H. Ford Joint Training Center, Kentucky


Role / Activities
Cadet Training Officer & Public Affairs Officer


Description
Served as Cadet Training Officer, developing and teaching classes to fellow cadets on leadership and technical subjects. As Public Affairs Officer, captured, edited, and managed photography; coordinated squadron communications and media efforts.


Key Takeaways
Developed training delivery and communication skills; gained experience in media relations and information management.


Rating
4 / 5





3. Ohio Wing Summer Encampment







Field
Details




Dates
2025


Location
Wright-Patterson Air Force Base, Ohio


Role / Activities
ATS (Aerospace Training Services) Flight Commander


Description
Led an aerospace training flight in hands-on STEM activities including rocket building and airplane simulator training at Beta Industries. As Flight Commander, participated in the full-motion C-17 simulator demonstration at Wright-Patterson Air Force Base—one of only two flight commanders selected for this advanced opportunity.


Key Takeaways
Advanced leadership experience; exposure to cutting-edge aerospace training technology; understanding of U.S. Air Force operations.


Rating
5 / 5

title: Civil Air Patrol Encampments
text:
Reflection
These three encampments have been instrumental in my development as a Civil Air Patrol cadet and as a leader. They have:

Strengthened my leadership capabilities through progressive roles and responsibility
Enhanced technical and aerospace knowledge through hands-on training and classroom instruction
Built professional discipline and military bearing through structured environments and mentorship
Developed communication and media skills supporting CAP communications missions
Provided exposure to U.S. Air Force operations at active military installations

These experiences have prepared me for advanced CAP opportunities, such as the Power Flight Academy, and have reinforced my commitment to pursuing a career as a U.S. Air Force pilot. The connections, skills, and mindset developed at encampments continue to guide my service and personal development.

title: National Cadet Special Activities (NCSAs)
text: National Cadet Special Activities (NCSAs) are advanced, week-long or multi-week programs designed to give cadets hands-on experience in leadership, aviation, aerospace, STEM, and emergency services. These programs allow cadets to expand their skills, network with peers nationwide, and experience specialized training beyond the squadron and encampment level. NCSAs represent some of the highest-level training opportunities available within the Civil Air Patrol cadet program.

title: National Cadet Special Activities (NCSAs)
text: National Cadet Special Activities (NCSAs) are advanced, week-long or multi-week programs designed to give cadets hands-on experience in leadership, aviation, aerospace, STEM, and emergency services. These programs allow cadets to expand their skills, network with peers nationwide, and experience specialized training beyond the squadron and encampment level. NCSAs represent some of the highest-level training opportunities available within the Civil Air Patrol cadet program.

title: National Cadet Special Activities (NCSAs)
text:
NCSA History

1. National Power Flight Academy







Field
Details




Year
2024


Location
Fremont, Nebraska


Program Focus
Flight Training & Aviation Operations


Duration
One week


Role / Activities
Participant in structured flight training program


Description
Completed comprehensive flight training including classroom instruction on aerodynamics, aircraft systems, and flight procedures. Accumulated approximately 9 hours of flight time in single-engine aircraft, including one solo flight. Gained hands-on experience in aircraft pre-flight checks, takeoff, landing, and in-flight procedures.


Key Achievements
Earned Powered Solo Wings certification; demonstrated proficiency in aircraft handling and decision-making under instruction.


Impact
Advanced my skills toward Private Pilot Certificate and reinforced commitment to aviation career.


Rating
5 / 5





2. Aircraft Manufacturing Academy







Field
Details




Year
2025


Location
Wichita, Kansas


Program Focus
Aerospace Manufacturing & Engineering


Duration
One week


Role / Activities
Participant in manufacturing and engineering program


Description
Attended specialized training focused on aircraft systems, manufacturing processes, and aerospace engineering. Participated in hands-on technical projects exploring production workflows, aircraft assembly techniques, and aerospace design principles. Toured manufacturing facilities and learned from aerospace engineering professionals.


Key Achievements
Gained comprehensive understanding of how aircraft are designed, built, and tested; developed appreciation for aerospace manufacturing complexity.


Impact
Broadened career perspective to include engineering and manufacturing roles in aerospace industry.


Rating
5 / 5





3. Specialized Undergraduate Pilot Training (SUPT)







Field
Details




Year
2025


Location
Columbus Air Force Base, Mississippi


Program Focus
Advanced Pilot Training & U.S. Air Force Operations


Duration
One week


Role / Activities
Selected participant in pilot training orientation


Description
Selected from competitive national pool to participate in advanced pilot training activities at an active U.S. Air Force base. Gained exposure to U.S. Air Force pilot operations, advanced flight systems, and military aviation procedures. Networked with Air Force pilots and experienced active-duty military culture firsthand.


Key Achievements
Selection from national competition; direct exposure to U.S. Air Force operations and career pathway.


Impact
Reinforced commitment to U.S. Air Force pilot career; provided clarity on military aviation requirements and expectations.


Rating
5 / 5

title: National Cadet Special Activities (NCSAs)
text:
Key Skills Developed Through NCSAs

Aviation & Flight Operations – Hands-on experience with aircraft systems and procedures
Technical Problem-Solving – Manufacturing processes and aerospace engineering concepts
Professional Discipline – Military environment and expectations
Leadership & Networking – Interaction with national cadet peers and aviation professionals
Decision-Making Under Pressure – Real-world flight and operational scenarios

title: National Cadet Special Activities (NCSAs)
text:
Reflection
Participation in these three National Cadet Special Activities has been transformative in my development as a cadet and aspiring aviator. These programs have:

Deepened my knowledge of aviation and aerospace through hands-on experience and professional instruction
Strengthened my technical skills in aircraft systems, manufacturing, and flight operations
Prepared me for future leadership roles within Civil Air Patrol and the U.S. Air Force
Expanded my professional network through connections with cadets, pilots, and aerospace professionals nationwide
Clarified my career pathway by providing direct exposure to military aviation and engineering opportunities

These experiences are instrumental in achieving my ultimate goal: to serve as a U.S. Air Force pilot. The knowledge, skills, and professional relationships developed through NCSAs continue to guide my decisions and inspire my commitment to excellence.
